text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with pork a latte that's right I'm
doing my take on this classic ancient
Italian recipe where pork is braised or

and delicious but do not let the name

are doing a little bit of false
advertising but the good news is this is
one of the most delicious pork stews
I've ever tasted
all right so step one we're going to go

while we do want those nice brown bacon
pieces in our stew this step is really
to render the bacon fat into that olive
oil so that we can brown our chunks of

five or six minutes so while that's
happening why not cut up our pork so I
have a nice fatty piece of boneless pork
shoulder and we're just going to cut it
in large chunks maybe like 2-inch pieces
and of course as always the exact size
doesn't matter but you do want to try to
get them evenly sized so that they all
cook at about the same rate it's kind of
a key point with Jews so we're going to
cut that up we're not going to do too
much fat trimming although if you do get
a piece that's just solid fat you can

chunka fied we're go ahead and season it

all right so mix it around good like a

all right so toss them in and let him

I told of go
and translucent and then of course we

I know usually chop it but I felt like

it's bad for the brain true story ask

going to switch to a whisk and we're

it's going to have a much more luxurious

yet
that's always a danger so try not to eat

in those are delicious nobody respects a

and then here's the plan
we're going to reduce the heat to low
and when that comes down to a nice

and we're simply going to simmer covered
until it's almost tender probably take

all right so forget time let it bubble
